item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: 📣🎉🎊 We’re #hiring a Digital Comms Manager.

Join us to:

👉 Combat Big Tech & State Intrusion into Rights online

👉 Promote the Rights of vulnerable, marginalised and minorities against Digital Threats

Interviews on a weekly rolling basis. Apply ASAP. https://www.openrightsgroup.org/digital-communications-manager-2/

item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: 📣​ NEW BLOG ​📣​

The UK Data Reform Bill and the British Bill of Rights: a tragedy in two acts.

"A combined effort by the Conservative Government to steamroll the rule of law and the freedoms we have always taken for granted." - @ds_m4riano. 

https://www.openrightsgroup.org/blog/the-uk-data-reform-bill-and-the-british-bill-of-rights-a-tragedy-in-two-acts
item.dc:creator: @OpenRightsGroup

item.dc:creator: @DuckDuckGo
item.description:
The UK is introducing a digital reform bill that will scrap mandatory consent for cookies.

@OpenRightsGroup says the proposal would make spying on people’s activities the “default option”.

@DanMilmo reports: theguardian.com/technology/2…

item.title:
📣​ NEW BLOG ​by @mssophiaakram

'PREVENT' and the attack on #FreeSpeech

"Reducing criticism of #Prevent to “enabling terrorism” is a poorly executed attempt to deny democratic discussion and ‘exchange’ of ideas. And as ‘policy’ it is farcically bad."

https://www.openrightsgroup.org/blog/prevent-and-the-attack-on-free-speech

item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: MASSIVE: 
Access to an intrusive and massive database of what you do online is finally being rolled out by the Home Office. 
Collection of “Internet Connection Records” and “the Filter” came in thru the post @Snowden  Investigatory Powers Act.
https://www.publictechnology.net/articles/features/excl-wall-silence-surrounds-plan-nationwide-collection-citizens%E2%80%99-internet-records
item.dc:creator: @jimkillock
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: Cookies are used to link activities across websites & build detailed, intrusive profiles of what you do, read & watch online.

The UK government proposal will make online spying the default option.

Our very own @ds_m4riano⁩ on Govt’s Data Reform Bill👇 https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2022/jun/17/uk-plan-to-scrap-cookie-consent-boxes-will-make-it-easier-to-spy-on-web-users
item.dc:creator: @OpenRightsGroup
item.description:

item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: V grateful to @LaylaMoran for raising this in Parliament. 

Here at @OpenRightsGroup we’re V concerned about the fate of British blogger, coder & free speech activist @FreedomForAlaa & proud to have joined civil society orgs incl @EFF @accessnow @SMEX in calling for his release.
item.dc:creator: @GhaffAl

item.title:
RT by @OpenRightsGroup: Govt is proposing to bonfire your rights & remove the protections that UK #GDPR affords to your private life, vulnerabilities & aspirations.

Under the populistic veil of “getting rid of cookie banners”, they want to make online spying the default option.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-61865575
item.dc:creator: @OpenRightsGroup
item.description:
Govt is proposing to bonfire your rights & remove the protections that UK #GDPR affords to your private life, vulnerabilities & aspirations.

Under the populistic veil of “getting rid of cookie banners”, they want to make online spying the default option.

item.title:
🚨🚨🚨 BREAKING: Joining forces with @the3million and represented by @LeighDay_Law, we have been granted permission by the High Court to a full hearing in relation to a second legal challenge of the Immigration Exemption.

https://www.openrightsgroup.org/press-releases/legal-challenge-of-the-immigration-exemption
